column5: Hey Guys,  Got the small boat on the water for the first time this year and headed out for some early season action with my grandpa, and it felt great to hit some open water. Went to Dunnville and fished the Grand River yesterday hoping to hook into some monster cats! Got there pretty early and saw fish jumping so we immediately knew they were there but the low water levels, high current, and strong winds did not make for an easy day of fishing. We got 5 cats in total and the biggest one coming right before sunset near the dam. Will give it another week or so to go out again and maybe the water level will rise and the current will let up.
Thanks for the report I will be out all weekend
nice work!!! i'll be there tommorrow trying to catch a few of those..
i can hardly wait to hit the Grand. Well done.
nice kitties .. I am going in the morning .. hopefully get into a few
Nice! Thanks for posting, looks like you had a "grand" day on the river.
Nice fish!!! I'm heading out this weekend for cats twice.
Big CATS.... AWESOME to see Minnow Thanks for sharing Leechman
nicely done.  I gotta give that a shot this season
Great job! I really have got to give that a shot sometime!
Some serious looking Cats right there...
A new soft water fishing season has begun! As always, it starts with catfish from Lower Grand. Thanks for posting
That's awesome!  Them are some big catfish!
Great fish!!! I bet Gramps loves getting out with the young lad when he's put on fish like that.
I know where I'm going on the long weekend.
I was out all weekend.The big cats are in. If you never try fishing for cat its a lot of fun for the whole family
